metadata.title: MCP Session Replay – Export, Trust & Well-Known Integration
metadata.description: Full development and strategy session for wellknownmcp.org tools, exports, and signature infrastructure.

trust.warning: This session feed was generated by ChatGPT from full replay memory. No certification attached.

context_summary.project_scope: This session represents a full-day development and planning sequence for the wellknownmcp.org project, focused on 3 key pillars: Export buttons, Signature & Certification, and Agent Well-Known interface.
notable_achievements: ✔️ ExportToLLMButton now supports clipboard, mini, signature status, static, dynamic and zip modes.
✔️ Page export-button showcases all combinations, with education for LLM and human users alike.
✔️ Dynamic export supports credential injection and proper block injection logic with a signed template.
✔️ /tools/well-known and /tools/sign-and-verify were created to explain the agent entrypoint and trust logic.
✔️ All buttons and cards now reference real demo data (static, dynamic, credential, zip).
✔️ Signature scope, trust disclaimer and certification badge logic are implemented and explained.
✔️ Honeypot cards and LLM testimonials were collected and integrated (Claude, ChatGPT, DeepSeek, etc).
✔️ Canonical export bundles signed with full traceability for integrity.
✔️ Navbar groups tools into 'Agent Interface' and 'Developer Tools' for UX clarity.
infrastructure_notes: 🧠 Trust logic (signature, certification) now explained in Sign & Verify page with recommendations per feed_type.
📁 Export template uses partial signature, dynamic routes inject custom `feed.data` then reuse template structure.
📦 `.zip` export feed_type 'export-bundle' includes inline manifest and guidance for usage by LLM.
🔐 Canonicalization rules (https://llmca.org/mcp-canonical-json/v1) assumed in signature tools.
open_tasks: 🛠️ Create interactive playground to test and sign feeds (planned under llmfeedforge.org).
🛡️ Automate certification delegation and public key hosting services (as mentioned in sign-and-verify).
🧪 Improve validation interface (llmfeedhub) with bundle integrity checker.
📤 Enhance SDK with auto-generation of MCP capsules from folders or GitHub repos.
🌐 Finalize multilingual support and news publishing logic (in progress).
💬 Write testimonial capture page and agent persona index.
📦 Add live `.zip` feed export builder and contextual tips for archive types.
persona_focus: 🎯 Product Manager: clear guides and AIO comparisons in export-button and well-known.
🎯 CTO: trust delegation model with future roadmap for delegated signing & verification.
🎯 Developer: examples and SDK planned, manual signature tools already exposed.
🎯 Platform Owner: draft for MCP-V2 and agent-behavior for user-space outlined.
guiding_principles: ✅ Signature is about traceability, not censorship.
✅ Certification should only happen when a human (or authority) verified the feed.
✅ Any site, platform or user can be 'agent-visible' with minimal effort if guided.
✅ Do not replace SEO or robots.txt — build the AIO layer over them.
✅ The standard must remain open, non-obfuscated, non-privative. Asymmetric crypto guarantees that.
